data.title: "zenMode.restore": true is global
data.body:
* open two windows, enable zen mode in one, leave the other as it
* have this config: "zenMode.restore": true
* quit VS Code and reopen
* both windows are in zenMode which isn't what I expect from `restore` and isn't what I want. The setting acts like a global setting

data.title: Accent menus shown in wrong location on macOS
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1 (2017-02-08T23:29:25.464Z)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create or open a text file
2. In the editor, press and hold a key with accents (or national characters) available (e.g. 'c'): https://support.apple.com/kb/PH25643?locale=en_US&viewlocale=en_US
3. The accent menu should show up right above the character just entered, but it shows up in the editors top, left corner.

data.title: On macOS sheets appear in the wrong location
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1 (2017-02-08T23:29:25.464Z)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

VS Code does not follow the human interface guidelines for macOS. Sheets, displayed by a window, should slide out under the window titlebar but the side out at the top in stead. I believe this change happened between VS Code 1.8.x and 1.9.x.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. View Extensions (⇧⌘X)
2. Select any installed extension
3. Click Uninstall
4. VS Code shows a Sheet asking Are you sure you want to uninstall '<extension name>'?

The top of the sheet is aligned with the top of the titlebar in stead of the top of the client view.

data.title: SCM: Cloning git repository into nonexisting folder
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try cloning repository into the new (not yet created) folder from command palette.
2. Unfriendly error is shown with no output. The gif below shows the behaviour.
![gif](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2239563/23307926/a5e72624-faa9-11e6-9644-8866eff7d282.gif)

I expect friendly message to appear, instead of ENOENT error code.

data.title: Broken Shortcut for "Toggle Editor Group Layout"
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
Trying to learn more on the features of VSCode, I attempted to toggle the editor group layout using its shortcut and found that it does not work. On the other hand, the action is successfully executed when done from the View menu in the menubar. Other shortcuts using the same keys separately work just fine in my computer which assures me that my keyboard is working properly.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional SP1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In an open instance of VSCode click  "View" from the menu bar.
2. Select option "Toggle Editor Group Layout  Alt+Shift+1" notice how the view group layout toggles between horizontal and vertical.
3. Attempt to execute the previous action by using the listed shortcut "Alt+Shift+1". Notice how it does not toggle the editor group layout.

data.title: Aid in migrating `editor.wrappingColumn` setting
data.body: We should let users know about the deprecation of `editor.wrappingColumn` (done in #21262), so they are aware they should update their settings.

data.title: Debugger doesn't recognize ES6 'import-export' feature
data.body:
I am getting the following error when trying to debug my ES6 javascript node app. It seems it doesn't recognize the ES6 'import-export' feature, however I am able to run my app fine in dev mode. Any ideas on how to fix this?

```
/Users/andriy.kulak/Sites/DV-Shared-RatingAPI/src/app.js:1
(function (exports, require, module, __filename, __dirname) { import express from 'express';
                                                              ^^^^^^
```
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set up launch.json config
2. in src/app.js - have at least one import of module in the following style "import express from 'express';"
3. Launch debugger

Below is my launch.json file for reference. Am I missing something here?


```
"version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/src/app.js",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "preLaunchTask": null,
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--nolazy"
            ],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "console": "internalConsole",
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null
        },
```

data.title: Switch workspace setting file from JSON to HJSON
data.body: [HJSON](https://hjson.org/) is a better format for JSON files that are meant to be edited/used by humans. Let's use it instead of JSON.

data.title: ATA does not work for libraries shipped with their own typings with es6 target
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an npm project
2. install a library that ships with its own typings like `mobx-react`
3. create a `jsconfig.json` like this:
``` json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es6"
  }
}
```
Note that the `"target": "es6"` is important.

**Expected behavior:**

have intellisense for `observer` in this code:
``` js
import { observer } from 'mobx-react';

observer();
```

**Actual behavior:**

Does not work!

**Note** that I found out it is related to `target` in `jsconfig.json`. If you remove target, it will work.

data.title: Intellisense not working for node js after some time
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. We have a large project, and after editing in it for a little while all javascript intellisense stops working, including for node modules, and local file functions, etc.

The workaround is to set `typescript.tsdk` in settings to my old install of typescript, which is version 2.0.3.

data.title: Powershell within built-in terminal non-functional and prints ^Q
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:44:55.542Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.13.0-106-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|jinja|wholroyd|0.0.7|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open built-in terminal (I used menu, CTRL+` doesn't seem to work for me on UK keyboard)
2. At the bash prompt, type powershell
3. Try to enter anything into the terminal and get a load of ^Q printed. Example output:

```
PS /home/rob/projects/powershellbackups> d^Q^Q^Q^Q^Q^Qi^Q^Q^Q^Q^Q^Q^Qr^Q^Q
dir : The term 'dir' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or
operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try
again.
At line:1 char:1
+ dir
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (dir:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException
```
![vscodeterminalps](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1683665/23305101/07e53830-fa95-11e6-9e8b-365b23a522b6.png)

Text input works fine at the bash prompt. Text input works fine in powershell in xfce4-terminal. No issues inputting text into any other elements of VS Code.

System has latest v6.0.0-alpha.16 Powershell Core.

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|

|vscode-todo|MattiasPernhult|0.8.0|

|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|phpunit|emallin|1.0.0|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|1.1.2|
|text-transform|florianloch|0.1.0|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.9|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11|
|theme-dark-starry-night|jerry|1.0.2|

That gave me some heart attacks, when I thought all the work has gone...

data.title: FTP links are highlighted wrongly and not openable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
Ref: #21021

- VSCode Version: 10.0.1-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10 / Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to terminal, type `echo 'ftp://ftp_username@example.com/folder/filename.gif'` and enter it.
2. Hover over it.

Only part starting from `//` is highlighted, and when clicked it does not open a link.

Not sure if we go for all protocol links support (would be good though), however it definitely should not mislead the user by highlighting the link.

data.title: Minimap: scrolling up in large file makes the slider jump a little bit
data.body:

1. macOS with zoom mode 1
2. large file with 30k lines scrolled all the way down
3. use mouse wheel to scroll up

=> the other scrollbar does not show this behaviour

data.title: Make some file specific commands work in both explorer and editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Some of our commands are duplicated to either run in explorer or the active editor:
* Copy File Path
* Reveal File in OS

Some of our commands are only supported in the explorer:
* Delete (move to trash & bypass trash)
* Rename

We should align this and have 1 command for each that works from either explorer or active editor:
* [ ] : `copyFilePath` to replace `workbench.action.files.copyPathOfActiveFile`
* [ ] : `revealFileInOS` to replace `workbench.action.files.revealActiveFileInWindows`
* [ ] : `moveFileToTrash`
* [ ] : `deleteFile`
* [ ] : `renameFile`

data.title: Improvement: method overriding
data.body:
Hi guys,

I often override methods because Django :rofl: I was wondering if Code can help me override methods which whispers me. Like if I hit let's say SHIFT + Enter onto whispered row it would paste the original method definition.

Example:

I type:
```python
def get_a
```

I get whispered:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198654/23300165/b03166dc-fa84-11e6-8fad-a87773c70706.png)

I hit SHIFT + Enter and I get
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/198654/23300209/dc817600-fa84-11e6-972b-37ace3ce818f.png)

Thank you and I'm sorry if this is duplicated task. I've looked around but found nothing.

data.title: Feature Request: Autosave on build
data.body:

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|language-x86-64-assembly|13xforever|2.2.9|
|read-only-indicator|alefragnani|0.6.0|
|alignment|annsk|0.3.0|
|Doxygen|bbenoist|1.0.0|
|vscode-astyle|chiehyu|0.6.2|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|matlab|Gimly81|0.4.0|
|status-bar-tasks|GuardRex|0.2.0|
|vscode-dimmer|hoovercj|2.1.0|
|docthis|joelday|0.4.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|vscode-clearcase|OpenNingia|1.6.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.2.0|
|theme-cyanicpastels|SamuelLampa|0.0.9|
|indenticator|SirTori|0.2.1|
|vscode-hexdump|slevesque|1.1.4|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.14.8|
|comment-snippets|Tobiah|0.2.0|
|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.2.4|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|
|highlight-trailing-white-spaces|ybaumes|0.0.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit a file.
2. Run a build command.
3. Expect dirty files to be auto saved before running the build command.

Don't think it should be for all tasks, but probably those marked as auto-save in the tasks.json. Would be good if it could be restricted to files with in the workspace folder. I can have outside files open, e.g. notes. Perhaps something like:
"autoSave": off (default)/all/workspace

data.title: Improve the formatting of editor.wordWrap description
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/23299259/301f6c80-fa81-11e6-8f7a-200915bd03ad.png)

- use new lines to get paragraphs
- use the 'enumDescriptions' property to add documentation for the values
 
e.g. see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/0a246ab31cacf5a2c997fcb4e8243c381a52bae9/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/files.contribution.ts#L238

data.title: ${command.xxx} deprecated syntax is not shown in tasks.json
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
Ref: #16064

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to tasks.json, change `"command"` attribute of the task to `"${env.Path}"`.
2. No highlight that this syntax is deprecated.

Works in launch.json.
